text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus argentata is the accepted name of an evergreen tropical oak species in the Asian sub-genus of 'ring-cupped oaks' and the family Fagaceae; there are no known subspecies. It derived its name from the silvery hairs on the lower surface of its leaves.The species is distributed in Borneo, Sumatera including Bangka, the peninsula of Malaysia, and western Jawa. It can grow 10 meters and up heights of 40 meters.
